result.execSummary:
The defendant Adrian Michael Summers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any sentence defendant is currently serving.
Consecutive to: any sentence defendant is currently serving

miscConds.notes: Not allowed to vote or sit on jury until civil rights are restored.  No contact with Marinette, Wisconsin Wal-mart store.

Submit DNA sample today.  Maintain full-time employment.    Undergo assessments, treatments, and counseling as recommended by agent.   If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Fine $100, plus costs, plus DNA surcharge, plus $142.50 service fees - work out payment with Probation agent.
Restitution of $1005.29 - Joint & Several.  Restitution has already been paid be co-defendant in case 15CF90.

timeConds.notes: No good time, credit for 0 days and huber release if in compliance with jail rules and regulations.  May serve in Brown County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
